capturing_peak_action::title: Capturing Peak Action
capturing_peak_action::preview_card_5::h: To capture moments of peak action requires anticipation and positioning. Photographers spend years perfecting these skills.
capturing_peak_action::markdown_card_0:::
## Always try to:  
• Seek out places and people likely to provide moments of peak action.  
• Don't only photograph the first thing you see. Be patient and the let the action evolve.  
• If it is a long event, plan your coverage for the right moments to photograph.
capturing_peak_action::preview_card_4::h: It is important to remember that sometimes a moment of peak action is more subtle, even intimate.
capturing_peak_action::preview_card_2::h: The moment of peak action can be a powerful reaction.
capturing_peak_action::preview_card_0::h: Good photographs are about action and emotion. The most powerful images capture the moment when action and emotions are at their visual peak.
capturing_peak_action::text_card_1::text: Now practice shooting photos at the moment of peak action. You may need several attempts to capture action that is not blurry.
capturing_peak_action::clip_card_0::goal: Capture peak action at a variety of distances, as Illustrated in the examples.
capturing_peak_action::preview_card_3::h: The moment of peak action can be an emotional interaction.
capturing_peak_action::text_card_0::text: A photograph must illustrate a story or scene in a single moment. To do that it has to be the right moment. This is called the moment of peak action.
capturing_peak_action::preview_card_1::h: Look for the moment of peak action when an action completes.
